item.title: 5 Open-World RPGs That Age Better Every Year Thanks To Mod Support
item.description:
If there’s one indisputable advantage that PC has over consoles, it’s the flexibility offered by thriving modding communities . Almost every popular game inevitably attracts enthusiasts who strive to enhance it, improving key areas or altering divisive elements from the original. As a result, players can tailor their experience to their vision, as mods vary widely — from minor additions like extra cosmetics, skins, outfits, or hairstyles to significant changes, such as rebalanced combat systems, graphical enhancements, removed level caps, expanded inventories, new weapons, armor, and much more. Some dedicated fans even create their own quests and entire campaigns for their beloved games, or produce spectacular conversion mods, sharing them with other players just for the fun of it.

Over time, several open-world RPGs have developed a true cult following for modding, with thousands of mods available to tweak every aspect of the base game. This grants an extended lifespan, allowing the game to improve over the years as more mods are created and released, bringing it closer to modern standards and delaying its obsolescence. Skyrim is often the first example that comes to mind, as is the case for most role-playing games by Bethesda, Obsidian, BioWare, and CD Projekt Red. Let’s take a look at some of the most notable modern open-world RPGs that aged gracefully thanks to active mod support, offering fans some of the widest selections of mods on the market.

Starfield

Despite A Slow Start, It Only Gets Better

We’ve already mentioned Skyrim as one of the evergreen pillars of the modding scene (along with Fallout 4 ), but let’s examine a more recent Bethesda game to see how fans and modding enthusiasts have embraced it. Starfield proved to be a highly divisive game at launch, seemingly failing to meet the lofty expectations set by its pre-launch hype. With a much grander scope than any previous Bethesda title, Starfield’s biggest challenge was its fragmented world of countless planets that often feel repetitive, diminishing the sense of a seamless adventure that the studio previously achieved with a single, expansive map. However, this doesn’t mean Starfield lacks potential.

One of Starfield's key selling points was its flexible ship-building and base-construction mechanics, offering even greater depth and versatility than those in vanilla Fallout 4 . These features were merely a starting point for modders, who continue to expand the original possibilities. This applies to nearly every other aspect of the game as well, including the character creator, weapons and gear systems, new quests and adventures, and more. Starfield also quickly received a variety of unofficial patches to refine the overall experience, addressing persistent bugs and introducing numerous reshades and custom graphics presets to enhance its visual appeal. Some ambitious mods even offer total conversions, such as transforming the game into a Star Wars universe, bringing fan-favorite aesthetics and atmosphere to this spacefaring RPG. It’s worth noting that Starfield features a curated platform called “Creations,” where players can access both official and community-made mods with seamless integration (though some are paid). Despite a less-than-stellar launch, it’s clear that Starfield continues to improve each year, thanks to both the core team’s efforts (such as the addition of the Rev-8 Rover vehicle) and the dedicated modding community, so the game’s best days are still ahead.

Cyberpunk 2077

A Lifepath Destined To Be Changed

Another example of an initially troubled launch, Cyberpunk 2077 isn’t simply aging well — it continues to evolve, with CD Projekt Red releasing patches and content updates for five years straight. Today’s vanilla Cyberpunk 2077 is vastly superior to its 1.0 version in every aspect, featuring substantial changes such as a complete overhaul of the skill tree, clothing and implants systems, as well as a proper police system. However, official support is just the tip of the iceberg compared to the boundless passion and dedication that modding enthusiasts bring to the world of Night City.

Despite being released five years ago, Cyberpunk 2077 remains one of the most visually stunning open-world games available, thanks to official implementations of cutting-edge technologies like path tracing. Mods take its visual grandeur even further, enhancing the quality of textures, materials, and models, improving or customizing the UI for a more immersive experience, and making NPCs more distinct and lifelike. Characters are the heart and soul of Cyberpunk 2077 , so it’s no surprise that countless mods expand the game’s character creator, introducing exciting new possibilities, outfits, and tattoos to help players craft the exact character they want to roleplay. This extends to new additions like weapons, ranging from guns to katanas and everything in between, as well as new driveable vehicles. Moreover, some truly game-changing mods introduce features like flying vehicles, fully dynamic quests and activities, and in-depth survival mechanics, allowing players to virtually live in Night City beyond its main story and side quests.

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord

Built On Flexible Foundations

Even in its vanilla form, Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord stands tall among open-world RPGs, offering unmatched flexibility in gameplay, tactical and strategic possibilities, and a realistic, historically grounded world. While it may lack the polished flair of typical triple-A titles and feel rough around the edges, it more than compensates with its sheer grandeur and freeform gameplay, allowing players to focus on the aspects they enjoy most. With all that, Bannerlord provides a near-perfect foundation for enhancement through mods, which largely target gameplay features and core mechanics, rebalancing or refining them for an even more immersive playing experience.

From detailed character creators, enhanced third-person combat, and the ability to roleplay as virtually anyone to more expansive features like reworked diplomacy, realistic smithing, improved large-scale battles with better AI, and more robust reputation and companion systems, there are no limits to what players can alter in Bannerlord to keep it fresh. Many mods also enhance the game’s presentation, adding immersive details, dynamic weather conditions, and significant graphical improvements. As with any great open-world RPG, fans can explore total conversion mods that transform Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord into, for example, Tolkien’s Middle-earth (Tales from the Age of Men) or George R.R. Martin’s Westeros (Realm of Thrones), among others. For hardcore fans, numerous mods emphasize the game’s historical roots, prioritizing accuracy and authenticity above all. With all these additions, Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord exemplifies a game that refuses to age, instead growing richer in possibilities with each passing year.

Elden Ring

Fan Mods Inspiring The Devs

Since its launch in 2022, Elden Ring has solidified its place as an open-world RPG that's built to last, maintaining impressively high player counts for years. This enduring popularity, combined with its PvP options, has made the game a favorite for modding. Already brimming with diverse character builds and combat possibilities, even multiple playthroughs won’t be enough to try out everything the game offers. However, dedicated players can extend their Elden Ring experience beyond its vanilla content, as mods breathe new life into adventures across The Lands Between.

One of the most notable mod additions is seamless co-op, which proved so popular that it seemingly inspired the devs to explore similar features in their next big titles. Randomizers are another standout category, making each Elden Ring playthrough feel fresh by shuffling enemy, boss, and reward locations, greatly enhancing the unpredictability of its world. Players can pair randomizers with mods that introduce new weapons, robust movesets, or even port bosses and weapons from FromSoftware’s earlier games into Elden Ring — a concept the developers themselves successfully embraced in Elden Ring Nightreign . Finally, given the game’s somewhat dated visuals (in terms of technology), numerous fan-made projects elevate Elden Ring’s visual fidelity on PC, with enhanced textures, models, lighting, and an overall richer atmosphere.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt Hasn’t Aged A Bit

In 2025, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt celebrated its 10th anniversary, yet it remains far from abandoned or forgotten. The devs have re-released the iconic RPG on all modern platforms with official enhancements and additions, making the Complete Edition an essential experience for fans of the Witcher universe. While The Witcher 3’s modding scene may not match the scale of Skyrim or other open-world RPGs from the past 15 years (largely due to the absence of a character creator), fans can still significantly enhance or transform nearly every element of the game to rediscover Geralt’s adventures.

Subscribe to our newsletter for modding deep dives and more

Inside the newsletter: curated coverage of PC modding scenes, deep dives into transformative open-world RPG mods, practical modding guides and spotlights, and thoughtful gaming analysis to help you discover and enhance the games you love.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

From countless new armor sets and weapons to find and craft, refined combat flow and animations, new Witcher perks and skills to master, and more challenging enemies and monsters to hunt, it’s like today’s vanilla The Witcher 3 serves as a foundation for the experience players want to create for themselves. Modders provide numerous graphics presets and custom lighting, improved textures and models (such as Halk Hogan’s Reworked Project NextGen Edition), additional quests to explore, and smaller but highly sought-after tweaks like unlimited inventory, an overhauled Witcher sense, or entirely new survival mechanics to make the game even more immersive and challenging. With no limit to the creativity of its fans, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is still well worth revisiting periodically to explore all the latest additions and relive Geralt's unforgettable adventures.

item.title: Logan Paul Just Gave His Daughter an Extremely Expensive and Rare Pokemon Card
item.description:
WWE professional wrestler and avid Pokemon Trading Card Game collector Logan Paul gifted his one-year-old daughter, Esme, a rare Shining Magikarp card for Christmas. Paul posted a video of the exchange on social media, which revealed that the Shining Magikarp card was worth approximately $9,000 based on recent sales on the Pokemon TCG market.

Known as the Fish Pokemon, Magikarp first appeared in Pokemon Red and Blue . Initially a weak Water-type Pokemon, Magikarp subsequently evolves into Gyarados, giving it a new appearance and vastly improved power. In Pokemon Gold and Silver, Shiny Pokemon were introduced to the franchise, with Shiny Magikarp receiving a rare, golden-scaled form. The golden-colored Fish Pokemon has since proven popular among Pokemon fans, with some creating various projects based around Shiny Magikarp. Shiny Magikarp first appeared in the Pokemon TCG in the Neo Revelations set as Shining Magikarp, a Basic Pokemon with 30 HP. Neo Revelation was first released in English in September 2001, and is the third set in the Neo series based on Pokemon Gold and Silver . Shining Magikarp and Shining Gyarados were considered the "secret rare" cards of the Neo Revelation expansion.

Logan Paul Gives His One-Year-Old Daughter A Valuable Pokemon Card For Christmas

On December 26, Paul shared an Instagram video of a Christmas gift he gave to his daughter Esme, a PSA 10 Graded Shining Magikarp Pokemon TCG card in a case. Paul said that the Shining Magikarp card was due to Esme choosing Magikarp as her Starter Pokemon, and the video stated that the Shining Magikarp had an estimated market value of around $9,000. According to TCGPlayer, Shining Magikarp cards of various qualities can be purchased as low as $183.64 after shipping. Paul, a notoriously avid collector of rare Pokemon cards like Illustrator Pikachu, had previously stated that Pokemon TCG products have a high return on investment overall. Paul paid $5.3 million for his prized Illustrator Pikachu card in 2022, and said he plans to auction it off in February 2026. It remains to be seen how much money Paul will make from his Illustrator Pikachu auction, and if it will come close to the $5.3 million figure he initially paid.

Although the former WWE United States Champion has not been shy about his passion for the Pokemon franchise overall, not all of Paul's ventures into the Pokemon TCG have proven successful. In November 2025, Paul entered a $34,700 bid for a Kabuto card during a charity auction hosted by Kabuto King on eBay. However, Paul was outbid by a Twitter user named cards.fun, who won the Kabuto card with a bid of $51,100. Kabuto King stated that, while Paul didn't win, his bid helped bring attention to the Kabuto card auction. Proceeds from the Kabuto card auction subsequently went to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.

The Pokemon TCG Keeps Going Despite Scalping Risks

Unsurprisingly, with Pokemon TCG products becoming a popular commodity with collectors and fans, they have also become an evergreen target for scalpers to sell them at much higher prices. This has forced some retailers to place purchase limits on various Pokemon TCG packs and decks, or lock early access to some sets behind a subscription like Walmart+. By comparison, GameStop issued a stark warning to scalpers via a November 2025 social media post, and said that it would ban scalpers from their stores if they are caught using a scale to weigh various packs.

Subscribe to our newsletter for Pokemon TCG collectible insights

Hungry for context on high-value Pokemon TCG moments like Shining Magikarp sales? Subscribe to the newsletter for focused reporting on market values, auction highlights, rarity context, and how collectors interpret price trends.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Pokemon TCG products are expected to remain valuable going into 2026, as the Pokemon franchise celebrates its 30th anniversary. As part of the festivities, Pokemon TCG will potentially collaborate with McDonald's by including promo cards and packs via Happy Meals. Given that this potentially requires a meal purchase, it remains to be seen what limitations will be put in place by McDonald's to deter scalpers from going after Pokemon TCG packs.

item.title: If You Are Curious About ARC Raiders, You Might Want to Take Advantage of This Limited-Time Deal
item.description:
ARC Raiders is getting a big discount for the holiday season, with the beloved multiplayer shooting available for a nice markdown on Fanatical for a limited time. The multiplayer extraction shooter from Embark Studios has been a smash hit among fans since its release in late October, quickly amassing a sizable playerbase. ARC Raiders sold over 4 million copies within less than two weeks after the game's launch, and posted impressive concurrent player counts above 700,000 as a new IP. ARC Raiders has also been a hot game for end-of-year awards shows.

ARC Raiders ' popularity has already seen the game receive consideration for major awards, even capturing an accolade just over a month after its launch. The 2025 Game Awards saw ARC Raiders taking home its first hardware, winning Best Multiplayer Game, with many fans feeling it should have captured more nominations. ARC Raiders has also received nominations for several accolades at the British Video Game Awards, even receiving a mention as a candidate for the awards show's "Best Game" award. Now, gamers are getting another chance to pick up ARC Raiders at a sizable markdown for a limited time.

ARC Raiders Gets Big Holiday Discount on Fanatical

  • ARC Raiders Standard and Digital Deluxe Editions 30% off on Fanatical

ARC Raiders is seeing a nice price cut on Fanatical, with fans able to save more than $10 USD on the game. ARC Raiders ' discount comes as part of the storefront's "Winter Sale," with the normally $40 ARC Raiders discounted to just $27.99 during the sale. The Deluxe Edition of ARC Raiders is also seeing a similar price cut on Fanatical during the promotion, marked down by the same 30% discount to $41.93 USD. Fans looking to pick up ARC Raiders for a nice discount will need to act fast, however, with the holiday sale only scheduled to last until 7:00 P.M. EST on January 5.

ARC Raiders ' newest sale comes on the heels of a big update for the game earlier this month. December 16 saw the launch of ARC Raiders ' Cold Snap update, introducing wintry conditions to multiple maps that can affect visibility and audio cues. The patch saw the launch of the new Flickering Flames event for ARC Raiders as well, rewarding players with a new outfit and cosmetics for completing the event's battle pass. Embark Studios has also pushed out weekly updates for ARC Raiders since its launch, though the developer has taken some time off for the holidays.

Alongside sweeping updates like Cold Snap, ARC Raiders has introduced multiple Raider Deck battle passes with some special rewards. ARC Raiders has featured two free Raider Decks so far, offering a mix of full-fledged skins and smaller attachments for completion. December 26 saw the debut of the brand-new "Goalie" Raider Deck, featuring some unusual new outfits for the game inspired by ice hockey goalies. Embark Studios has also teased new kinds of Raider Decks for the game coming in the future, with the premium battle passes expected to include even more exclusive cosmetics.

ARC Raiders ' early popularity has seen the game receive plenty of praise from fans for its technical presentation and gameplay. Many fans have heralded ARC Raiders as a true evolution of the extraction shooter, particularly praising the atmosphere and tense action sequences presented by the game. Critics have positively compared ARC Raiders to 2024's Helldivers 2 , which took the gaming world by storm and captured multiple awards, including last year's "Best Multiplayer Game" honors. For fans who have been waiting to dive into ARC Raiders , Fanatical's Winter Sale should be the perfect time for new players to see what the frenzy over the game is all about.

10 /10

ARC Raiders

Little remains of the world we know today. The mysterious machines of ARC threaten any possible settlement on the surface and communities are forced below the ground to survive. Most people are content just to see another day. Others have chosen a bolder path. They are known as Raiders.

item.title: Steam Users Have 2 Freebies That They Can Claim Right Now, But Time is Running Out
item.description:
Steam users have just a limited amount of time left to claim two freebies currently available on the platform, and one of them, the twin-stick shooter Undercroft Warriors , will only be on offer until the morning of December 31. At any given moment, PC gamers can usually find at least a few games that are being given away for free, whether that be via Steam, the Epic Games Store, GOG, Amazon Prime Gaming, Itch.io, or several other digital storefronts.

Taking Steam as an example, in the month of December alone, PC gamers have been able to add about 12 games to their library completely for free. These have included a gamut of genres, from the pixel-art indie horror adventure Just Ignore Them or Banana Hell, a challenging platformer where you’re dressed up as a fruit, to the open-world survival RPG Wild Terra 2: New Lands . Most recently, a 100 percent discount for Caveman World: Mountains of Unga Boonga, a retro-inspired platformer set in prehistory, was being offered until December 30, 10 AM PST.

Steam Offers That Are Expiring Soon

  • Undercroft Warriors (until December 31 at 10 AM PST)
  • Train Sim World 6: Spirit of Steam: Liverpool Lime Street – Crewe Route Add-on (until January 5 at 10 AM PST)

Currently, there are two freebies to claim on Steam, but the first, Undercroft Warriors, will no longer be available to claim after 10 AM PST on December 31. Undercroft Warriors is a stylistic twin-stick shooter features an attention-grabbing pixelated black, white, and red graphic style while it pits players against the seemingly incessant and ever-increasing forces of hell. There are six heroes to choose from to take on the skeletal foes, and each has a different arsenal of weapons and abilities. The goal is to kill as many enemies as quickly as possible, increase your multiplier, and grab the high score.

Steam users have a bit more leeway to claim the second giveaway, Train Sim World 6: Spirit of Steam: Liverpool Lime Street – Crewe Route Add-on , as it doesn’t expire until 10 AM PST on January 5. Even if you don’t own the base game, the DLC can still be claimed, though Train Sim World 6 will of course be required to play it. Conveniently, both the standard and Thomas & Friends editions of Train Sim World 6 are also on sale until January 5. Spirit of Steam: Liverpool Lime Street – Crewe Route Add-on was released on August 26 and, as its name suggests, it adds the 36-mile Liverpool Lime Street to Crewe route as it existed in 1958. Developer Dovetail Games recreated the stations, tracks, and infrastructure to be historically accurate, giving players a chance to experience what it’s like to carry passengers on an LMS Jubilee Class locomotive during the era of steam trains.

There Is Another Free Game to Claim on Epic Games Store Right Now

Many PC gamers also won’t want to miss the latest game being given away for free by Epic Games Store. Since December 18, the digital gaming storefront has been giving away a new title every 24 hours in celebration of the holidays. The fourteenth free title being given away by Epic Games Store is Trine: Classic Collection , and it will be available to claim at no cost until December 31 at 8 AM PST. This particular giveaway is particularly enticing because the Classic Collection includes the complete editions of the first four games in the highly rated series of puzzle-platformers. The only title missing from the collection is Trine 5: A Clockwork Conspiracy, which happens to be discounted 60 percent until January 8 on both Epic Games Store and Steam.

item.title: 15 Best Female Heroes In BioWare Games, Ranked
item.description:
Few companies have cemented their names in the history of RPG gaming like BioWare has, and they are responsible for some of the most iconic female characters in history. The developer's catalog of games reads as a must-play list for many gamers, with Mass Effect and Dragon Age coming out on top as their landmark releases. The original Mass Effect trilogy took players on a galaxy-spanning adventure as Commander Shepard with his/her crew fighting to save everyone from the Reapers.

Meanwhile, the fantasy series Dragon Age introduced players to the continent of Thedas, where religious zealotry, dark blood magic, and high adventure are everyday occurrences. BioWare has always included strong and complex female characters in its games, with a few becoming true icons for fans around the world.

Only characters from games developed by BioWare will be considered here.

15 Mission Vao (Star Wars: Knights Of The Old Republic)

A Skilled And Loyal Friend

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
Released
July 15, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
Xbox (Original), iOS, Android, Switch, PC, macOS
Genre(s)
RPG
Powered by

Star Wars: Knights of The Old Republic is a landmark RPG set within the Star Wars Universe, 4,000 years before the formation of the Empire. In the game, players can create their characters and choose their path. They can go towards the light side or the dark side if they wish.

Throughout the game, players will meet different characters they can recruit as companions. One such character is Mission Vao. Mission is a young Twi’Lek who is discovered in the Undercity on the planet Taris and has high stats in Dexterity, Stealth, and Demolitions. Vao's rise to fame was meteoric, from living on the streets to being named one of the saviors of the galaxy by the Republic. She started the first part of her life surviving with her brother, who would teach her everything but eventually abandon her. These painful early experiences would not break her, though, as she would form a close bond with the Wookie Zaalbar.

14 Ashley Williams (Mass Effect 1, 2, & 3)

An Accomplished Soldier Loyal To The Cause

Mass Effect
Released
November 20, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Powered by

Ashley Williams is a human companion in the Mass Effect series, who becomes a powerful ally for Commander Shepard. Players first meet Ashley on Eden Prime during a large-scale invasion of Geth. Shepard meets her at a particular low point, helping her after her entire unit is killed. Ashley decides to continue to fight with Shepard against Sarin and the Geth. She is a capable soldier and becomes a loyal friend to both Shepard and the crew of the Normandy.

She appears in all three Mass Effect games, as a companion in the first and third games, and as a cameo in the second. However, players can also choose to sacrifice her in the first game. The character is a voice of reason for Shepard and also a potential romance.

13 Aveline Vallen (Dragon Age 2)

A Powerful Leader And Warrior Who Loves As Hard As She Fights

Dragon Age 2
7 /10
Released
March 8, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, PC, macOS
Genre(s)
RPG
Powered by

Aveline is a powerful warrior who becomes a close ally of Hawk throughout the story. Players will first meet Aveline when she and her husband are fleeing from Darkspawn in Lothering. Hawk will save Aveline, but it will be too late for her husband. She later becomes a member of the city guard, rising to the rank of captain.

Aveline lives by a strong moral code. She is powerful and confident in battle, yet a little socially awkward in her personal life. She is a likable character in the game, with some of the best humor coming from her side quests. In combat, she is a tank that can deal large amounts of damage.

12 Miranda Lawson (Mass Effect 2 & 3)

More Than Just Perfection

Mass Effect 2
8 /10
Released
January 26, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Genre(s)
Action RPG, Third-Person Shooter
Powered by

Although she was emphasized in Mass Effect 2 's marketing, Miranda Lawson largely exists in the shadow of many of Commander Shepard's female crew, particularly Liara and Tali. A Cereberus officer engineered to be perfect, Miranda initially comes across as detached, cold, and by-the-books, like she is there to ensure Shepard sticks to the game plan. However, that facade does not really last long, and she warms up surprisingly quickly once she starts to build a relationship with not only Shepard but also other crew members.

While her personal arc is not as powerful as, for example, Jack's, Miranda goes on a well-executed journey that is defined by her search for autonomy, agency, and identity. Her loyalty to Cereberus and her father partially stems from a desire to protect her sister, and she remains true to herself even as she breaks away from their shackles.

11 Leliana (Dragon Age: Origins, Dragon Age 2, & Dragon Age: Inquisition)

The Eyes And Ears Of The Inquisition Working From the Shadows

Dragon Age: Origins
9 /10
Released
November 3, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Genre(s)
RPG
Powered by

Leliana is one of the key returning characters in the Dragon Age series. She first appears in Dragon Age: Origins in the early game and can be recruited into the player’s group. Leliana is an Orlesian Bard, who is a skilled performer and deadly warrior. She is an expert with her duel blades and a master archer.

The character features throughout the Dragon Age series, making only a brief appearance at the end of the second game. However, it is only in Dragon Age: Origins that she is a playable character. In Dragon Age: Inquisition , she takes on the role of spymaster for the player, proving her talents in politics and subterfuge. Leliana is one of the central characters in the series and has become one of the most influential in the setting.

10 Dawn Star (Jade Empire)

A Powerful Warrior And Devoted Follower

Jade Empire
Released
April 12, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
Xbox (Original), PC, Android, iOS
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Powered by

Released in 2005, Jade Empire was an action role-playing video game by BioWare based on ancient Chinese mythology and history. In the game, players control a character known as The Spirit Monk. This character can be either male or female, and players can choose between six different character archetypes for a playthrough.

In Jade Empire , the player will come across many different characters, some of whom can be recruited to become followers. Dawn Star is a potential follower and romantic interest for male characters in the game. She is a skilled fighter and can replenish the player’s Chi.

9 Dr. Liara T’Soni (Mass Effect 1, 2, & 3)

An Ambitious, Intelligent, And Passionate Companion

Liara is an Asari, a powerful galactic species that appears to be entirely female. Members of the Asari race are naturally powerful biotics who can manipulate dark energy at will. Liara is a leading scientific voice in the Mass Effect universe and an expert on the ancient race known as the Protheans.

Throughout the series, Liara is a romantic option for either male or female Commander Shepard and can be recruited as a party member in the first and third games. During Mass Effect 2 , she becomes an influential information broker who helps Shepard in the quest to stop the collectors. In the DLC, Lair of The Shadow Broker , it is possible to help Liara further her influence and become the mysterious Shadow Broker herself.

8 Cassandra (Dragon Age 2 & Dragon Age: Inquisition)

Fiercely Loyal And Dedicated To Her Faith and Friends

Dragon Age: Inquisition
9 /10
Released
November 18, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Powered by

First introduced in Dragon Age 2 to investigate the lead character, Cassandra is the Right Hand of the Divine. The Divine is the leader of the dominant religious order in Thedas. During the events of the third game, Cassandra joins the Inquisition and becomes an integral part of the story.

Subscribe to our newsletter for BioWare character deep dives

Dive deeper into BioWare’s unforgettable heroines and the design choices behind them, subscribe to the newsletter for curated character spotlights, lore breakdowns, developer insights, and recommended titles that expand your appreciation of RPG storytelling.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

She is a powerful warrior who is dedicated to her mission and loyal to her friends. Cassandra is an extremely religious individual, with much of her morality coming from this fact. She is also a romantic option for players in Dragon Age: Inquisition .

7 Viconia Devir (Baldur’s Gate 1 & Baldur’s Gate 2: Shadows of Amn)

A Dangerous Friend And Deadly Foe

Baldur's Gate
Released
December 21, 1998

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
PC, macOS
Genre(s)
RPG
Powered by

Before Larian Studios took over the Baldur’s Gate franchise and created one of the most critically acclaimed RPGs in recent gaming history, BioWare created the original foundation. Baldur’s Gate 2 was released in 2000 and was once again set in the Dungeons and Dragons setting of The Forgotten Realms.

Available to recruit in chapter one of BG1 and chapter two of BG2 , Viconia Devir is a neutral-evil Cleric who is a perfect anti-hero companion in the game. She is a Drow (or Dark Elf) who has strong magic resistance and high dexterity. She is a skilled warrior who can use several different melee weapons, and she can be a romantic option for certain males. She also appears in Baldur's Gate 3 in the Cloister of Sombre Embrace.

The above image of Viconia is from Baldur's Gate 3 . We went with this for the sake of delivering a higher quality image.

6 Flemeth (Dragon Age: Origins, Dragon Age 2, & Dragon Age: Inquisition)

A Powerful And Secretive Witch Who Has Lived Many Lifetimes

Flemeth is a powerful NPC character who appears in all three of the Dragon Age games. Within the lore of the setting, she is a long-lived character who has appeared in many ancient legends. She goes by many different names, including the Witch of the Wilds and Asha’bellanar by the Elves.

While never being an outright hero, she does give aid to the player, most notably in Dragon Age 2 by rescuing the protagonist at the start of the game. In Dragon Age: Origins , she is also a minor antagonist to her daughter, Morrigan. On top of that, she is one of the most powerful characters in the series. She is a shapeshifter and can take on the form of large creatures, including dragons.
